title: The future of menus includes upcycled ingredients - Food Business News
summary: The Spare Food Co. has launched Spare Starter, a culinary ingredient made from surplus farm produce that aims to reduce food waste while promoting sustainable food practices. Chefs can incorporate it into various dishes, emphasizing a 'plant-forward' menu. The initiative aligns with growing consumer interest in sustainability and aims to make overlooked ingredients essential in food service.
green_innovation: TRUE - The Spare Starter promotes sustainability by reducing food waste and utilizing surplus vegetables that are typically discarded.
business_innovation: TRUE - Spare Starter represents a new and improved product that differs significantly from previous offerings and has been introduced to the market.
green_product: TRUE - Spare Starter is a good that is designed and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact by minimizing food waste.
green_process: TRUE - The practices by The Spare Food Co. reflect a green process by utilizing waste materials and minimizing environmental impacts during food production.

greenwashing: FALSE - There is no evidence of greenwashing in the article; the company is actively addressing food waste and promoting sustainable practices rather than making unsubstantiated claims.

title: How Progressive Grocer's Impact Awards Winners Are Improving the World - Progressive Grocer
summary: ALDI has partnered with Alexâ€™s Lemonade Stand Foundation for a fundraising campaign every June over the past five years to support childhood cancer research. Customers can purchase lemonade stand supplies and reusable bags with artwork supporting the foundation, with funds raised contributing towards the cause. ALDI also matches employee donations to further support families affected by childhood cancer. The retailer aims to donate $10 million to ALSF by 2027.

title: PepsiCo Announces Agriculture Accelerator Projects to Support Farmer Livelihoods, Scale Sustainable Innovation and ... - PR Newswire
summary: PepsiCo has announced the third year of its Positive Agriculture Outcomes Accelerator, which will catalyze over $30 million in investments to support nearly 40 agricultural projects addressing significant challenges in agriculture. This initiative focuses on climate resilience, improved soil health, and other sustainable practices across nine countries. The program aims to foster innovation and collaboration among local farming communities and ag-tech startups. Through these projects, PepsiCo seeks to advance its pep+ agenda and promote regenerative farming practices by 2030.
green_innovation: TRUE - The initiatives described aim to enhance environmental sustainability by improving soil health, reducing greenhouse gas emissions, and fostering climate resilience in agriculture, all of which are key components of green innovation.
business_innovation: TRUE - The Positive Agriculture Outcomes Accelerator represents a new or improved process undertaken by PepsiCo to advance agricultural sustainability, which significantly differs from their previous operational methods.
green_product: FALSE - While the article discusses sustainable agricultural practices, it does not specifically identify a product that meets the criteria of a green product as defined.
green_process: TRUE - The described projects, such as implementing sustainable farming practices and irrigation systems that reduce water use, exemplify green processes aimed at minimizing environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 111 Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting; 311 Food Manufacturing; 541712 Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences (except Biotechnology); 92112 Administration of Urban Planning and Community and Rural Development
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not present misleading information about the environmental benefits of the initiatives; instead, it outlines authentic efforts to invest in sustainable agricultural practices.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Comments on Tax Court Decision - Yahoo Finance Australia
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has expressed disagreement with a recent decision by the U.S. Tax Court regarding a tax dispute with the IRS, indicating plans to pursue an appeal. They assert a belief that retroactive tax liabilities should not be applied based on a differing calculation methodology that had been previously agreed upon. The company continues to focus on its beverage portfolio and its efforts towards sustainability and positive impacts on the environment.
green_innovation: TRUE, because Coca-Cola discusses efforts to positively impact the planet through sustainable practices like water replenishment and packaging recycling.
business_innovation: TRUE, this statement reflects business innovation as Coca-Cola is actively transforming its product portfolio and seeking to introduce new products to the market.
green_product: FALSE, because the article does not specifically identify any single product that meets the stringent criteria for being labeled a green product.
green_process: TRUE, because the mention of sustainable sourcing practices and packaging recycling indicates processes that minimize environmental impact.

title: ofi officially opens state-of-the-art dairy processing plant in New Zealand - Food and Drink Technology
summary: Olam Food Ingredients (ofi) has officially opened a new dairy processing plant in Waikato, New Zealand, designed to produce dairy ingredients like whole milk powder for various applications. This facility will enhance ofi's global dairy manufacturing capabilities and strengthen its partnerships with farmers and customers. The company emphasizes sustainability and has introduced a sustainability strategy for its dairy business to support its farmer partners in achieving sustainability goals by 2030.
green_innovation: TRUE; the new facility focuses on sustainability, addressing the need for environmentally sustainable dairy production and supporting farmers in achieving social and environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE; the facility's establishment and production of innovative dairy ingredients that cater to diverse customer needs signify a new and improved business process for ofi.
green_product: TRUE; the dairy ingredients produced at the facility are designed to meet sustainability concerns and minimize environmental impacts.
green_process: TRUE; the processing methods at the new facility aim to minimize waste and conserve natural resources, aligning with the principles of green processes.

title: Mavala's ultimate guide to beauty features skincare-infused make-up range - Global Travel Retail Magazine
summary: Mavala has launched a skincare-infused make-up range that includes Serum Foundation, Perfect Concealer, and Magic Powder, focusing on natural ingredients and eco-friendly practices. The new Mini Bio-Color collection features bio-sourced nail polishes made up of 85% natural-origin ingredients. The brand aims to educate consumers and promote wellness while emphasizing sustainable sourcing and eco-friendly packaging to meet growing environmental concerns. Mavala seeks to align with the trend of beauty and wellness becoming interconnected.
